extendedIngredients.name: ahi tuna steak

extendedIngredients.name: ahi tuna steaks

extendedIngredients.name: balsamic vinegar

extendedIngredients.originalName: Mix together the balsamic vinegar with the hazelnut oil

extendedIngredients.originalName: Take a frying pan and heat one tbsp olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: Sprinkle over 3 more drops of olive oil and serve without waiting, with a dash of lemon juice if you like.

extendedIngredients.name: Salt & Pepper

extendedIngredients.name: seeds
extendedIngredients.original: Take a mortar and crush all the spices seeds together (except for the fleur de sel).
extendedIngredients.originalName: Take a mortar and crush all the spices seeds together (exce for the fleur de sel)

extendedIngredients.name: zucchini
extendedIngredients.original: Chop in small cubes the other zucchini.

extendedIngredients.name: zucchini
extendedIngredients.original: Cook one zucchini cut in pieces in boiling water for 10 mns or so. Mix it well with a hand processor (30 s is enough).

for 10 mns or so. mix it well

extendedIngredients.name: mix

meta: with the beetroot and set aside.

extendedIngredients.name: sear on each side
extendedIngredients.original: Sear on each side for about 30 s or less. Make sure the tuna flesh stays rosé.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Sear on each side for about 30 s or less. Make sure the tuna flesh stays rosé

title: Seared Spiced Tuna with Zucchini — Thon aux épices sur lit de courgettes
summary: Seared Spiced Tuna with Zucchini — Thon aux épices sur lit de courgettes might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 1052 calories, 99g of protein, and 60g of fat. This recipe serves 6. For $14.87 per serving, this recipe covers 46% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up grate your beetroot, sprinkle over more drops of olive oil and serve without waiting, take a plate and in the middle, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the balsamic vinegar you could follow this main course with the Skinny Strawberry Ice Cream as a dessert. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 85%. This score is awesome. Try French in a Flash: Moroccan Spiced Seared Rare Tuna, Reckless Abandon: Seared Ahi Tunan on a Bed of Zucchini Ribbons and Whole Wheat Pasta with Spicy Sauce, and Tunan and breadcrumb stuffed courgettes for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Matanzas Creek Alexander Valley Merlot with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 28 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Matanzas Creek Alexander Valley Merlot
productMatches.description: A medium purple color. Flavors of satsuma plum, dark chocolate covered raspberries, and allspice aromas primarily. On the palate, this is a classic Merlot with good concentration. It is savory and medium bodied with velvety tannins. Homemade cherry pie tart and sandal wood aromas are perceived easily when tasting.
